judges: Before Bell, O. J., Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
This appeal raises the question of whether a zoning ordinance had been validly enacted. The lower Court sustained its validity. We find no merit in any of appellants’ contentions.
Order affirmed.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Robert M. Mountenay, with him Smith, Mountenay, Mims & Wilson, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
Mager, Appellant, v. Kulp.
Argued January 8, 1965.
Before Bell, O. J., Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
reargument refused April 7, 1965.
March 16, 1965:
Cyril L. Weston, for appellants.
Robert M. Mountenay, with him Smith, Mountenay, Mims & Wilson, for appellees.
